Posts.Content: Hi Luthien, I can't add to the sound advice you have been given but just wanted to give you my love and support. Once you start the journey and are able to focus on the end goal it all becomes easier. I'm sure the work thing will work out just fine. Keep posting, you've got lots of new friends here gunning for you :)
Posts.Title: Just back from follow-up appointment after mammogram - bad news!

Posts.Content: Hi dear Mandz, I had much the same and am inclined to get red irritable skin on my face when I am stressed. Before my op I went running a lot which really helped the stress levels. I was stupid and overdid it straining my achilles though :( !! So don't go crazy, but something which makes you feel you are satisfying the fight/flight may well make you feel better. Be nice to yourself, this is a time to indulge both mind and body. And I promise nothing will be half as bad as you are imagining.  thinking of you
Posts.Title: effects....

Posts.Content: Hi Charlene, thank you for asking questions I too would like the answers! I have been recommended Endocrine manipulation with Tamoxifen but have not actually been given the prescription yet, maybe I will get it after Radiotherapy. I had highest score, 8 for positive oestrogen receptor. However I am 58 and have not had a period for several years so I am confused why I am being prescribed Tamoxifen rather than an Aromatase inhibitor such as Letrozole. I had been on HRT before my diagnosis. Now I'm off it I can remember why I went on it!! Hot flushes, anxiety, sleeplessness, muscle craps, aching joints.  I wonder if different Endocrine manipulation drugs effect people differently? Is it possible to switch till you find one with the least side effects? Is there a way of measuring your Oestrogen levels, seems ludicrous to take a drug unless you definitely need it? Keep us posted on what you find out and good luck :)
Posts.Title: I am all mixed up - what's the difference between Letrozole and Tamoxifen...

Posts.Content: Hi Charlene, I wish I could write French as well as you write English! I have requested you as a friend so we can message privately. No need to bore the pants off everyone else!! I look forward to hearing more about you and how you are getting on with treatment away from home which must be difficult and lonely. Lots of us here giving you love and support.
Posts.Title: I am all mixed up - what's the difference between Letrozole and Tamoxifen...

Posts.Content: Hi Charlene, thank you for getting this thread started, it has been really helpful to get all the feed back from so many kind souls and I've learnt a bit from it. Let us know how you get on. Sounds like a bit of a minefield but at least there is the option to try different pills to see which works best for you. Does anyone know if a hormone test is informative, my Oncologist seemed to think not? I would like to know if a drug I take is having the desired effect. If it is, it is easier to tolerate the side effects!
